website_summaries.verdict: Sectional carbon fiber monopod offers versatility. Lightweight model also provides plenty of stability.
pros: When fully extended, monopod measures 61" in length
Doubles as a sturdy walking staff
The sections lock in place tightly
Offers a good handgrip and a wrist strap
Comfortable to use all day long
cons: Sections of the monopod may stick over time, making it tough to extend

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality lightweight monopod.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the shorter and lighter size and am very pleased. I already had a Manfrotto 679 monopod that is very good but it is a minimum of 24 inches long where the Sirui is 15 inches long and, of course, lighter in weight. I use both with a Manfrotto 3229 tilting head which I understand has been replaced by a newer model. The Manfrotto pod is quicker with only three sections and it is very sturdy for support in stream crossings or such but the Sirui is also very smooth to use and easier to carry and it goes in my backpack. Both are great choices but different.
customer_reviews.author: RONWA

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Great affordable, lightweight, sturdy monopod... Removed the wrist strap and compass, and added a quick release. Uncomplicated! Just the right height when fully extended for my 6 foot frame. Also works well in the retracted position, held tight to my chest. Sturdy enough to double up as a walking stick. No more excuse for blurry pictures!
customer_reviews.author: KS56

customer_reviews.title: The perfect monopod
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for a monopod that was light weight and very sturdy to support Nikon D500 camera with large lens. It is exactly what we were looking for although be advised that it is not as small as some other models available and I would recommend getting the manfrotto 234RC attachment for quick release of the camera. Also the manfrotto 234 tilt head will allow you to make quick adjustments if you are doing sports photograph. The attached picture shows the size of it completely compressed with the manfrotto tilt head attached and the camera next to it for reference is a Nikon D500 with 70-200 lens. Hope this helps you.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: BEST MONOPOD I'VE EVER USED!
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite Monopod. It's small enough to fit in a carry on case in an airplane, lightweight, simple to use along with being practical for those who like to not carry bulky tripods. I like that I can use it at its shortest length creating a small handle that keeps my hand steady as I take photographs. Extended it is solid on the ground easily moved to any angle you may want. I have stopped taking handheld photographs because this little monopod helps me take sharper and focused photo's better than without it. Love this monopod!
customer_reviews.author: Dr Horn

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased 2 of these. The first one was fine for about a year and then the knobs stopped tightening and the sections would slide a bit. The 2nd came completely apart from the top section. Instead of replacing the monopod, Sirui sent plastic shims that I have to install myself. I guess for 1/3 the price of competitors....you get 1/3 the quality and customer service. As they say, 'fool me once'....
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my camera gear.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this monopod to replace on old one that had plastic clips on the legs, and was not very sturdy for some of my equipment with larger lenses. The Sirui P-326 is sturdy, and can also be used while hiking for a walking stick, and the screw clamps on the legs are much sturdier than the plastic clips on my old one. I am sure I will get many years of service with this for both photography/video and hiking to get that perfect nature shot or clip I need.
customer_reviews.author: Keith JonesTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: High quality -- very impressed with this
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I'm amazed at what a great piece of work this is. Super lightweight, easy to extend and collapse, and very stable. It extends high enough that even a tall person can use it easily, or a normal height person standing on a rock or something. The smooth working of the extender rings is a treat, and the grip is big enough to give you a great hold on it. Definitely something I'll be using for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Willow Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by a disabled veteran / pro photographer
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement to my old one that I left at HEB and someone else found it. My monopods serve double duty as I use them as a cane too. I am a disabled combat veteran that needs the support to be able to stand and walk. The SIRUI P-326 really does support 22lbs and more! The only shortcoming for this monopod it the foot/spike cannot be removed. HOWEVER, if this was only being used as a monopod and NOT a mobility support cane then that may not be a problem. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: DouglasB

customer_reviews.title: Compact, light very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Thus far works great and will support my weight if used as a walking stick. Quick turn leg locks MUCH easier than levers and appear to hold well. Carbon fiber build is excellent. Lowest leg segment is 16mm diameter and very sturdy. Hidden spike at bottom extends with turns of the rubber foot. Using with Sinnofoto Q-08 head for a mirrorless APS-C DSLR. Extremely pleased.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Low quality and over hyped product
customer_reviews.text: Hand part is super cheaply made and will thor up easily ... connection parts are very flimsy and makes the monopod not sturdy ... It is compact ,but very overpriced item when you think about cost to produce one ...not a professional item in my opinion...
customer_reviews.author: Concerned Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Gotta Love Those Twist-tightening Telescoping Legs
customer_reviews.text: Just, please, get out of my face with this.... Strong, light....accommodates both thread sizes... I very much prefer the twist tighten telescoping legs...for their infinitely adjustable ranges for one.... Also, they won't loose their grip over time...because you just tighten them!...No 'snap' or 'click' that one day just becomes just to loose to support any weight. You get the silly compass and it's hardly worth mentioning... I love it. I use it for binoculars, primarily.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Otterbine

customer_reviews.title: Small and light!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a lighter upgrade to an older Bogen aluminum/alloy that was just to heavy. I use this monopod with Nikon D4 cameras and a Nikon 200-400 and a Sigma 120-300 lenses. Fully extended it does seem to flex a bit but nothing that would inhibit shooting. Both combos are pretty heavy and it does hold well. The twist locks are secure and quick. One thing I don’t really like is twisting 5 sections as opposed to using a flip lever to get the right height. Takes some getting used to. For the price and size, you can’t go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: apice

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't buy again
customer_reviews.text: This gets good reviews but it's really not sturdy enough for a 1DX and a 400 2.8. It flexes quite easily and feels relatively flimsy. It might be adequate for a smaller lens like the 70-200. I don't really feel comfortable with the 400 on it. The mounting plate seems to be part of the problem since it is far less rigid than the plates on my Gitzo, 3 legged thing, and Oben.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality Lightweight Monopod for a Good Price.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this Monopoint. Using it with My Sigma 60-600 lens. Bought the SIRUI Monopoint head for it and the combo do a good job. Have their carbon fiber Tripod which I have had for 8 years. Was happy with the quality of that Tripod so knew I could count on the SIRUI quality. I wasn’t disappointed. Definitely a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M. Steinberg

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a sturdy monopod
customer_reviews.text: I thought to use this monopod for birding and to set my camera. In big letters it should say--buy a flexible attachment so you can aim your camera at the subject matter. The camera did sit on it and it was secure, but you can't move the camera up or down or sideways. So I will get the attachment next, so I can use this properly.
customer_reviews.author: PanamaM

customer_reviews.title: Videographers: do NOT buy this product!
customer_reviews.text: Videographers: if you’re looking for steady footage without hang movement/shaking, this is NOT the product for you. I bought this for video and it did not give me any stability in my footage. It came out shaky and basically looking like it was a hand held shot. My advice: get a tripod or invest in a better product for stability. This is definitely not worth $100.
customer_reviews.author: madison

customer_reviews.title: Only one issue, this has to go inside the ...
customer_reviews.text: Only one issue, this has to go inside the checked in luggage if you travel, Keep the ball head in your photo bag that makes it less valuable for thieves while in transit.
customer_reviews.author: English_Wolf

customer_reviews.title: as expected
customer_reviews.text: great monopod i use it for a long lens. only one issue the boot should have a locking dot in addition of the screw my lens is heavy and after a while the boot start to move sideways. so i have to open the boot and re-tide the screw. a locking dot would have done the job better.
customer_reviews.author: Pierre TinelTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good Alternative to Pricey Manfrotto
customer_reviews.text: I like this monopod. Now, if I had a choice between the high-end Manfrotto and this at the same price, I'd take the Manfrotto. This works very nicely, however. Solid materials and easy to adjust. Great for shooting in low light. I did buy a pivoting head separately, which is a nice addition to help with flexibility. If you're looking for a nice monopod without wanting to take out a second mortgage, you will be happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Happy

customer_reviews.title: purchased this for my Sigma 150-600 Sport lens
customer_reviews.text: Read many reviews regarding the best mono-pod out there for sports photography. I've only been able to use this once, it's very light but there is some flex when I put it down with my Nikon D500 and Sigma lens which together weigh 8 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: David J. OBrien

customer_reviews.title: Nice monopod
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic little monopod. It's short enough to fit on my backpack and I don't have to fully extend it to take pics, I'm 5'10". It is nice and sturdy even with my heavy canon mounted on it. I use it to shoot concerts where a tripod is out of the question. If I'm moving around I clip a small pouch to my belt loop and open it far enough to shoot comfortably. I can shoot 2.5-3 stops faster with a 200mm lens.
customer_reviews.author: David Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: so very handy
customer_reviews.text: Personally, I use this monopod WAY more often than the three other tripods I have. The monopod feels very sturdy, unlike the tripods, the single leg feels strong and solid, but surprisingly light weight. You can attach the camera straight to the monopod, but it's probably a better idea to get some type of head for it. I have the Manfrotto (Up/Down Swivel) quick release head. The ball head may have too much movement, since the monopod is easier to manipulate than a tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Jose G. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Too short for my 6' 2" frame.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and solid. I wish it was 2 inches taller. I'm 6' 2" and need to order an extension for the monopod. I guess Chinese photographers are mostly short compared to us americans.
customer_reviews.author: David Ludwig

customer_reviews.title: Amazing mono
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to monopods, but I can't imagine them getting much better than this. It is extremely light and compact but screams durability. You'll know what I'm talking about when you get it. It's just great. This, in combination to the manfroto 234RC, you'll be able to support very heavy glass (I use the canon 100-400 which weighs in at just over 6 lbs) with ease. Some people complain about the extending mechanisms that rotate instead of the clips, but I like this much better. It's obvious there's nothing to snag on, and it seems extremely sturdy. I look forward to using it more! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Keith S. Napolitano

customer_reviews.title: But boy did I also get a great quality monopod
customer_reviews.text: I switched from a Manfroto to this because I wanted a monopod that would collapse to a smaller size when carrying strapped to the side of my Tenba backpack. But boy did I also get a great quality monopod! This thing is plenty sturdy for me when I use it with my 7DMkII, 70-200 f/2.8 WITH 1.4X extender on sports shoots. Easy deployment, and even faster collapsing when done. Sold my Manfroto - sticking with this!
customer_reviews.author: Buck Kasey

customer_reviews.title: Very Light Weight but STABLE.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Sirui carbon fiber monopod to take on a cruise. I am very impressed with how stiff the monopod is when extended while it weighs significantly less than my 3 piece aluminum Manfrotto. When folded this will easily fit into a carry-on suitcase. And for a very reasonable price!
customer_reviews.author: Bill Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Great Compact Monopod!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Very compact - Light weight - Extends pretty high - Comfortable grip - Retractable metal spike - Rotating wrist strap - Sturdy - seems to hold pro DSLR and lens just fine - Large number of sections for fine adjustment(s) Cons: - Threaded base where camera attaches can be loosened a little too easily -- would like to see more secure way of locking this down
customer_reviews.author: surfingump

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel
customer_reviews.text: Collapses small, super lightweight, purchased for travel but has a spike on the end so not sure I can take it ....maybe in checked luggage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It really is a fantastic monopod. I took pictures of a regatta in ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this with the Sony a6500 and 70-300G lens, and it worked perfectly. It really is a fantastic monopod. I took pictures of a regatta in Seattle in the snow and rain, and this was an essential element of my getting the pictures I got. So glad I went for it.
customer_reviews.author: e40

customer_reviews.title: Best one after shopping around
customer_reviews.text: I looked at a lot of carbon fiber monopods before ordering this one. I didn't want to pay the price of the Gitzo and I liked this one better than the Manfrotto. Very happy with the build quality and value. It is quite strong despite the many sections, collapses down to a very short package and light for travel. Nice soft handle. If you get lost trekking there is a little plastic compass on the strap but woe to you if you get lost without a GPS.
customer_reviews.author: Richard CastilloTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: One of the best monopods I have used.
customer_reviews.text: Great lite weight and compact monopod. On a recent trip to Africa, I injured my left knee and for two weeks because of it's strength, it also served as an excellent cane. One of the features I really like is how easy it is to extend and collapse. Also because of the compact length, it easily fits into a carry on bag or back pack.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Stroven

customer_reviews.title: Nice range of small for transport to tall for shooting.
customer_reviews.text: This is prefect for me. I just acquired a BMPCC 4K video camera, and it's pretty heavy. This stabilizes it perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Jan R. Klincewicz

customer_reviews.title: Compact, light and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great monopod. Of all the monopods that I have seen that can accommodate my heavier Nikon D3X, this one is one of the lightest and most compact of all. It extends easily by twisting the knob wheels and contract just as easily. The padding on the grip helps to keep this monopod stable and enable it to be used in any kind of weather. Definitely a handy travel prop. for photographic work.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Arnold

customer_reviews.title: SIRUI P-326 6-Section Carbon Fiber Mono-Pod
customer_reviews.text: On the Appalachian Trail in the New England Autumn of the calendar year to capture the foliage, .... to Rocky New England Coastlines with which to capture my favorite Raptors, .... Simply indispensable as a means with which to reduce camera "shake" when shooting .... Its carbon fiber structure carries the qualities of both lightness as well as strength as I trek lengthy and rough-underfoot unblazed trails to distant and recluse locations to capture my subjects by way of .... Superb.
customer_reviews.author: Mark D. Loveland

customer_reviews.title: Replaces my Gitzo Series 2
customer_reviews.text: Got this because it collapses smaller than the Gitzo. The maximum extension is not as much as the Gitzo, and if you had to fight off bears, the Gitzo would probably better, but the Sirui is no slouch. I have the Sirui paired with a Manfrotto 234RC QR head and it does everything I need it to do as well as the Gitzo at half the price. I use it to support a Canon 7D, often with a 70-200 lens. To me the Sirui doesn't even give up any asthetic points to the G. Nice monopod if the dimensions work for you.
customer_reviews.author: MT Nester

customer_reviews.title: Good Monopod at an acceptable price.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product, if you do not want to carry a tripod. I have to admit I have somehow "shaky" hands for photographing. Although I have a light tripod, this monopod is a nice alternative if you are on the go. Good quality. Very good product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: CarIhl

customer_reviews.title: Great Monopod
customer_reviews.text: I've had this monopod for about a week and so far I love it. For President's Day weekend, I went on several hikes and a deep sea boat excursion and used the monopod the whole time. It's very durable, it can go to a really good height, and it held my 15 pound camera and lens without a problem. I didn't buy a quick release head and I can see where it would be beneficial, yet I did ok without it. I like how compact and lightweight it is. It has made me wonder why I didn't buy a monopod sooner!
customer_reviews.author: I. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect travel companion for those who want some camera stability without having to setup an entire tripod. The carbon fiber makes this very light. It's easy to set up and collapse, and it's very compact, easily fitting into a backpack or bag. The materials appear of excellent quality. It can double as a hiking/walking stick, and even has an attached compass. I lost mine and have ordered a replacement, as I'm going through withdrawal. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Z

customer_reviews.title: Good monopot!
customer_reviews.text: I brought this to travel for two weeks, and I was really happy, as this pod was working well and did not give me any troubles in the whole trip! Good product!
customer_reviews.author: EmilyCTexas

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous 6-segment Sirui monopod
customer_reviews.text: This item, combined with a, has proven to be a great combination for a Panasonic LX3 camera for both photos and video. The two items together will (tightly) fit in awith the F-2 mounted and folded over, which makes a handy way to carry them both around by the shoulder strap. This Sirui monopod is professional in all aspects. I highly recommend it. (Segments twist to lock/unlock.)
customer_reviews.author: Bob Drake

customer_reviews.title: Get this!
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly lightweight, quick and easy to configure. Fits in a pocket on the outside of my equipment backpack and clips to a nearby strap. Works fine as a walking stick but I hope I will never need the compass that's included. You may want to purchase a tripod head that provides at least up-and-down tilt for your camera in situations where you don't want to lean the monopod at a high angle.
customer_reviews.author: BrewersFan1955

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, light weight
customer_reviews.text: sturdy, light weight, collapses nice and small. great for hiking. It worked better when I added the ball-head from my tripod. the straps aren't really heavy duty though and fell off after a few uses.
customer_reviews.author: Lars R. Jones

customer_reviews.title: We're going to Italy and tripods are not welcome in ...
customer_reviews.text: We're going to Italy and tripods are not welcome in many public buildings(churches and cathedrals). The monopod is light, and hopefully will get by the entrance personel at the chrurches.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Rothschild

customer_reviews.title: Well Designed
customer_reviews.text: This is a well designed monopod. It is compact and relatively light. Any one if the sections can be independently adjusted. It is solid if you want to use it as a hiking stick. It has a clever, yet simple way to switch between mounting screw sizes. The bottom tip can be changed from rubber to a spike by simply turning the rubber tip.
customer_reviews.author: Gary T

customer_reviews.title: Loving this monopod!
customer_reviews.text: This monopod is awesome! I've had the same monopod for years and used it nearly every day, but it was time to replace it and I'm glad I found the SIRUI. Easy to extend and withdraw, and stays put when you tighten the mounts. With the six sections you can really vary the height to exactly what you need, and it folds down so small it fits in my ThinkTank roller bag perfectly. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: RandomPhoto

customer_reviews.title: great for a heavy lens!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use on a 70-200 canon lens while at a cheer competition. Seating was very tight and a tripod would have been out of the question. This is very stable and feels great. I was able to take the weight off my wrists on this huge and heavy lens. it adjusts quickly and works wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy M. Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Super lightweight and solid
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight, nice solid grip at top, fairly easy to extend - you can unscrew all sections at once with the average size hand/palm and tighten each ring with a quarter turn. Sure, not as easy as clips, but you're talking a few seconds of difference. Probably good as a hiking stick too.
customer_reviews.author: SH/MD

customer_reviews.title: Great Monopod at a Good Price
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a sturdy, economical, light monopod that collapses to a shortest possible length, this is it. I use it with an ancient Leica ball head I've had for decades. The combination packs well, is very inobtrusive in use, and sturdy enough for my D7000 and long lens. Never heard of this company from China. Looks like they might be new competitors. China makes most of our stuff already, now it looks like they'll be keeping the profits, too. Scary new world.
customer_reviews.author: Piano Student

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous Value in a Compact and Lightweight Monopod
customer_reviews.text: An excellent buy for the money and perfect for travel. I bought this on the basis of other reviews and it did not disappoint. This collapses down to 18.5 inches and is lightweight which makes it very easy to tuck into a backpack or suitcase without taking up precious space. This is a great value.and a very good monopod. The leg locking mechanisms may take a fraction of a second longer to lock then a flip type, but they are still very fast and easy to use and stability is not a concern. I actually choose this over my more expensive Manfrotto monopod just because its size and weight are just so much more convenient. .
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: Nice and light
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was hoping for. Nice and light, compacts to be quite small yet sturdy and tall enough for my 5 foot 10 inch self. It easily adjusts and tightens so that it doesn't' slip between heights. I bought it to take photos at a horse show and it was perfect. It can fit OK without a head, but it is easier on and off if you put a quick release head on it.
customer_reviews.author: Lorna M. Willard

customer_reviews.title: Works well stability of camera
customer_reviews.text: Useful stability for camera indoor or outdoors . Easy to carry lightweight .
customer_reviews.author: M. DeMott

customer_reviews.title: a nice surprise
customer_reviews.text: I have only used tripods and usually when I do I'm irritated because I feel like they are such contraptions. I decided to purchase a monopod because I wanted something lighter to carry around all day for a photo safari. I feel like I struck gold! I love this monopod! I may never see the light of my tripods again. This is very easy to use, sturdy and compact.
customer_reviews.author: TakeAPic

customer_reviews.title: Great Monopod!
customer_reviews.text: Durable, rigid, light... exactly what you'd want in a monopod! Not much more to say... I completely satisfied with a well made product that does exactly what I need it to do!
customer_reviews.author: Andy P

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: Overall a very good product and I recommend it. Only thing I’m not pleased with is the time it takes to use the ‘rolling locks’ on each extension as opposed to the tab style locks found on my tripod.
customer_reviews.author: tntenn10

customer_reviews.title: Quality made. Light weight
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good monopod. Not a quick release but works well & strong & lightweight. I think it's worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: billy COLE

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Well built
customer_reviews.text: For the money hard to beat! Very slight wobble on the last leg, but I don’t extend all the way and is fine!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Rose

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Monopod
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this monopod based on other Amazon customer recommendations. I also purchased a Sunwafoto Discal Clamp DDY-58 to attach to the top of it and a Maglite ASXD036 D-Cell flashlight holder to carry the monopod on my belt. Took them to the Galapagos Islands and they worked very well. The monopod is a great device and very reasonable priced compared to other more costly monopods. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Azzarello

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing.
customer_reviews.text: I love this monopod. I have had a Manfrotto and a super cheapie that I was using, but I started to shoot heavier lenses and camera Body (D4 with 200-400f4 lens) and the cheapie started to collapse when it wasn't suppose to. This one is solid and compresses to a TINY size that fits inside my roller bag. I love that it compresses to much because I shoot while sitting down a lot.
customer_reviews.author: R. Harmer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely high quality
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the quality of the Sirui P-326 monopod. It is much sturdier than expected and fast to deploy and and collapse. Works very well with my Nikon dslr and variety of lenses. Works with and without a ball head. I use the Sirui G-20 ball head when I expect to flip the camera or need to anchor the monopod at angles. Very impressed with Sirui.
customer_reviews.author: james h.

customer_reviews.title: Terrific on Safari
customer_reviews.text: This product was the ideal solution to providing lightweight travel, versatility and stability while on a 3 week safari in South Africa, Zimbabwe and Zambia. Maneuverability for high telephoto shots while in the vehicle on safari drives was superior to using a bean bag. This is a very high quality, well made monopod, accommodating both 3/8" and 1/4" heads.
customer_reviews.author: Scott C.

customer_reviews.title: Supports the lens fine. Love that it locks down real well
customer_reviews.text: Wife uses it for her 300 2.8. Supports the lens fine. Love that it locks down real well. A little noisy sometimes which has the potential of startling wildlife.
customer_reviews.author: George W. Mason

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very good first monopod for me. Light yet strong, easy opened, easy closed, and easy adjusted. Did a great job of stabilizing my camera (Nikon D7200 with 55-300 Zoom, so I gave it a pretty good test run. Used it as a walking cane and it is just fine.
customer_reviews.author: BobY

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Monopod! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this monopod for my xmas gift. Best decision I made. I wish I would have had this for my trip to Europe last year. I love using monopods and tripods but the older ones I had weighed too much. This makes taking a monopod a no brainer! This is light weight and very easy to put into your bag and carry. I love it and it is extremely user friendly!
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Solid monopod. It handles a very heavy Nikon 200-400 ...
customer_reviews.text: Solid monopod. It handles a very heavy Nikon 200-400 lens with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: KLB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent monopod
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use on an extended vacation and I was very pleased with it. Collapses small enough to easily fit into a suitcase or even a backpack. Light but sturdy. I have an aluminum monopod that is of good quality but I haven't used it since buying this one. Well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: AFG008

customer_reviews.title: Carbon Fiber Monopod
customer_reviews.text: Very light and easy to use. Works great with the Manfrotto ball head. Wonderful build quality
customer_reviews.author: Herbert

customer_reviews.title: I like the retractable metal tip and it extends it's the ...
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight and compact. I like the retractable metal tip and it extends it's the proper height (with attached ball head and camera) for me (5'6"). I think it could still be extended a little more for someone taller too.
customer_reviews.author: Kaaren C

customer_reviews.title: As good as it gets.
customer_reviews.text: I have a tripod from the same company. Excellent quality and workmanship. Fairly priced. Well designed. Likewise this monopod has all the same attributes . Excellent for a DSLR with most any lens.doest need a head with quick release plate. Does not have to be a ball head but that becomes a matter of personal choice. Light weight but aturdy.
